page.title: 12Chickney, employment & trade
page.content: Most of the employment is in connection with the farms, growing and harvesting the crops or tending the livestock which includes poultry and turkeys. The farmer who has a milk round employs men to deliver the milk in this locality. One or two larger houses have a gardener and one farm goes in for horticulture in a commercial way. There is a pit selling sand for building, a timber supplier and on the site of the old Thaxted station a coal depot. There are a few people living in the area who travel to work outside. Builders, electricians and plumbers have to be called out from a town when needed but the men on the farms are able to do the maintenance of machinery and a great deal of the household and farm equipment.
